information: Donald Trump has a history of attending UFC events in the United States, typically appearing at 2 to 4 cards per year since 2019. All of his previous appearances have been at domestic events. He has a strong personal relationship with UFC President Dana White. Trump recently attended a UFC event in Miami in April 2025. Historically, he has not attended two consecutive numbered UFC cards within a one-month span; UFC 315 is scheduled to take place four weeks after the Miami event.

forecast.no_outcome_scenario: UFC 315 is outside the U.S. or in a less convenient market, or the President’s schedule (official travel/commitments) conflicts; no marquee ally/fighter on the card; he skips the event.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: UFC 315 is a U.S. PPV in Las Vegas/Florida/New Jersey with a marquee matchup; Dana White invites and logistics align; he appears cageside or elsewhere on venue grounds.
forecast.rationale: Base rate: Since 2019, Trump has attended roughly 2–4 UFC cards per year, almost exclusively U.S. events. That implies attendance at a minority of numbered cards in any given year. The research assistant notes he just attended a Miami event in April 2025 and that he historically has not attended two consecutive numbered cards within a one‑month span. UFC 315 is about four weeks later, which lowers the odds versus a typical card. Key uncertainties: location and card strength. If UFC 315 is in the U.S. (likely for most PPVs) and especially in Las Vegas with a major headliner, his close relationship with Dana White and his pattern of leveraging UFC appearances for positive reception could push odds up. Conversely, if it’s international (e.g., Abu Dhabi/Canada/Europe) or in a less convenient market, attendance becomes very unlikely. Status quo favors No: for any given card, he usually does not attend, and the short gap since his last appearance further dampens the chance. Why not higher: unknown location/card, proximity to his April appearance, and presidential scheduling constraints. Why not lower: he has an established pattern of showing up to UFC PPVs multiple times per year and strong ties to Dana White; if this is a domestic marquee PPV, attendance is plausible. Updaters: - Up if UFC 315 is confirmed Las Vegas/NY/NJ/FL and features a major star or MAGA-aligned fighter; or if White/Trump publicly hints at attending; or if the President’s schedule places him in the host city that weekend (could raise to 35–60%+). - Down if UFC 315 is international/Canada/Europe or in a less convenient U.S. market, or if official travel conflicts (could drop to 2–8%).

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Donald Trump attend UFC 315?

Question background:
AP [Trump sits cageside at Miami UFC event in his latest appearance at a sports event](https://apnews.com/article/trump-ufc-miami-fight-sports-6461901bb3d5f2eec477674d02333a7f)


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if President Donald Trump is anywhere within the grounds of the venue where [UFC 315](https://www.ufc.com/event/ufc-315) takes place. Otherwise this resolves as **No**.




Your research assistant's report says:
Donald Trump has a history of attending UFC events in the United States, typically appearing at 2 to 4 cards per year since 2019. All of his previous appearances have been at domestic events. He has a strong personal relationship with UFC President Dana White. Trump recently attended a UFC event in Miami in April 2025. Historically, he has not attended two consecutive numbered UFC cards within a one-month span; UFC 315 is scheduled to take place four weeks after the Miami event.

Today is 2025-04-28.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
